resources.string: I am educated as a bassist and teacher at the National School of Art and at the Institute of Art in Havana, Cuba. I also studied Live Electronics at the Norwegian Academy of Music and pedagogy at the Barratt-Due music institute. I have been working as a professional bass player with a number of well-known and unknown artists and bands.\n\n As a teacher and mentor I have done several workshops and projects for and with children / young people, including at Steinerskolen and through Kulturtanken. I have also taught bass / guitar for students of all ages, both as a private teacher and as a permanent employee at Music Education Norway (MUNO).
Get an original composition for your project
The Cuban Spectrum Project is a Caribbean afro-Cuban-Scandinavian jazz crossover band founded by Alejandro Gispert in 2015.
This performance is an offer through The Norwegian Cultural program for students in grades 1–7, It builds on the theme around being different and unique.
Beautiful presentations of cuban traditional music for all ages but especially the elders.
Do you need help to come forward. This is the place for you, regardless of age, gender and level. The teaching takes place individually.

The objective of this game is to find and mark all the words hidden inside the box. The words may be placed horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Some clues of the hidden words are provided. This word search puzzle game had been created as a tool to my workshops and have as main goal learning more about music language, as well as music instruments and its parts.
Developer: Alejandro Gispert \n(Taking as an example a sourcecode from Ari)\nMusic Theme: Relaxed (by Alejandro Gispert)
